title: Strengthen the housing benefit system, to make it more accessible and accountable to the public.
body:
The housing benefit system has been underfunded and underburdened in recent years. Despite giving an average of £82 a week to the average family of 3,000, it is now estimated that the average person in England is expected to pay £23,000 for housing, and yet are not given a basic income.

This has been a major issue for many in the housing sector, and made it very difficult for the government to tackle the problem.

It is time for the government to review the housing benefit system and make it more accessible, accountable and accountable to the public.

title: For the Government to implement a 'No Deal' Brexit deal to stop the 'recovery' that is happening and to stop the 'threat of another Brexit'.
body:
In light of the Brexit negotiations, we are now in a difficult time to optimise for the future.

With the current uncertainty in the EU and with the uncertainty in the UK, we need to ensure that we do not get in the way of the Brexit process.

The government's Brexit negotiations will be based on the premise that the people of the United Kingdom will have the final say on whether the UK is to remain in the EU or leave the EU.

The government is also not responsible for the Brexit negotiations, and therefore we can't be sure.

The government, however, is responsible for ensuring that the government, and the European Parliament and Council are consulted.

The Brexit negotiations should therefore be a 'no deal' scenario that offers a commonsense alternative to the 'hard Brexit' scenario.

title: Make it a legal requirement for all medical practitioners to have a full training in the pain management of the body
body:

This would make training in the treatment of the private parts of the body a necessity, and would fundamentally change the way the UK is run.

body:

The way forward is to remove the Renovations of the A/C, the Bridges and the Erections of the Houses of Parliament. This is for the public to see and to pay for.

The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for removing an MP's or making changes to an MP's membership of an organisation's political party. The decision to remove an MP from a political party is a decision for that party.

We believe the dates of the referendum are not the date of a fair referendum which is deliberately delayed in order to undermine the democratic process which is important for the UK.

title: Force all third parties to work together for a fair and just future.
body:
We believe that for the people of the UK, the government should force third parties to work together to ensure the future for its citizens.

We think it is unfair that third parties are not paid enough to provide the support and support that third parties do not provide.

We believe that the government needs to force third parties to work to represent our views and fairness, and to work together to achieve the best possible outcome for the UK.

body:

body:
Newcastle is a small town that lost all our local councillors on the 18th of March 2016. We want to see that the government do more to protect New Castle Town and our local residents.

The government need to impose a law that requires Councils which have a responsibility to report to the Ministry of Justice and the Police to the new Castle Town Council on the basis of what has come to light over the last 12 months.

body:
There is no system, or law, which allows to families to be denied financial support and resources for the children of single parents.

It is unfair on the poor and vulnerable families who are forced to rely on governments to provide for their families.

We call for the re-establishment of de-bursary for single parents who are in need of support but cannot and cannot afford to do so.

We call on the government to re-establish the de-bursary system, after the children are born, and to re-establish the de-bursary system for single parents who are in need of support, if that is not possible.

We believe that single parents are being priced out of the system of work for a reason, and a parent who is in need of support, should be allowed to provide for the children of single parents alone, without being priced out of the system of support for the children of single parents.

body:
Bravery is the road to safety and is vital to everyone on the road.

Drivers are expected to be on the road as they have a high standard of safety and the proof of the driver's driving skills to give us the best chance of winning and getting out of trouble.

Award them with a badge of the highest possible standard and it should be recognised as such.

body:

We believe that since 2004 the UK has become a pioneer in providing free school meals to all children.

We believe that the government should use this opportunity to help all children as they are being judged by the Government on their ability to learn and to earn their freedom.

title: Stop the Mandatory Removal of Local Police Officers in Myriad Cities
body: I want the government to make a mandatory provision in the Local Police Act that whenever there is a case of violent crime in a local police force, the local police force will be removed. This is a necessary step in a society where there is no protection against this type of crime. Businesses and police forces will benefit from this provision.

title: Remove the statue of King George VI from the grounds of the Houses of Parliament.
body:
King George VI, King of England and Scotland, died on 30th June 2019 at the age of 90.
He was an iconic figure in the UK and was a beloved symbol of all of the people of Britain.

Britain is a cosmopolitan country and he was an icon in this country. We now have a statue of him in Queen Victoria Square with a statue of Sir Victoria's statue on the upper left.

The UK needs to remove this statue and we need to remove this statue from Parliament grounds.

title: NHS to save more than a quarter of the NHS budget
body:
This petition is to demand that the NCA reforms the system to make the NHS more competitive.

The NHS is currently in a financial crisis and its budget is being squeezed by a huge number of people, especially for the NHS.

This would mean that the NHS is in a financial crisis and that its budget is being squeezed by a huge number of people.

This is a national disgrace and the NHS is currently in a financial crisis and that's why we cannot afford to fund our own NHS.

We demand that the government takes action to save the NHS and make it more competitive.

title: Scrap the existing TV licence
body:
For the first time in the history of the UK, the TV licence should be scrapped, rather than just scrapped, as it is becoming increasingly difficult to watch a live TV show for free.
We will not be able to watch it on a TV where people can pay for a subscription. Also, the television licence is one of the main benefits of the current system.

title: Stop the funding of the NHS
body: I would like the government to stop funding the NHS and instead fund a program that helps those of us who need it to succeed.

title: Re-introduce a 'classified automatic' voting system.
body: I think that the current system of voting should be reworked so that only registered voters can vote.

title: Make it illegal for companies to charge exorbitant prices on plastic bags
body: It is clear that it is not a good idea to charge a ridiculously high amount of money to remove plastic bags from our streets. These plastic bags are too costly to remove and are often a hazard to wildlife and to health. If you are concerned about your wildlife, you may want to consider purchasing a wildlife refuge, such as a zoo, or buy a new pet.

title: Introduce the 'Life Time Penalty' for killing a dog.
body:
Many dogs suffer the constant stress and pain of being taken from them by humans for the purpose of killing them. We call on the UK Government to introduce the 'Life Time Penalty' for killing a dog.

In the UK, at some point in an individual's life, the owner has to pay a certain amount of money to the dog. If this is not paid promptly, the dog dies, the owner of the dog must pay a lot more in damages. If the dog died as a result of this, the dog must be taken from the owner as soon as possible.

The law states it must be an offence to kill a dog when it is under the influence of a controlled substance, when the dog is under the influence of alcohol. The law states, "a dog is not a dangerous animal, but must be kept in reasonable safety even though it is under the influence of alcohol."

title: Reform the rules on a private early access operation for women who are taking maternity leave
body: A private early access operation is being introduced for women who are taking maternity leave from their current employer and have a child. The system is discriminatory and leaves many women with no choice but to go to work and pay what is due. The government should review the rules around this and ensure that all women are treated fairly.

body:
The police are not good enough for me and I am concerned about the homeless and the police are not good enough for me and I am concerned about the homeless and now the police are in such close proximity to the homeless. This is a step in the right direction from the wrong direction, to take British taxpayers money and put it into the hands of the Afghan army.

title: Stop the sale of HGV to private companies
body:
I am campaigning to stop the sale of HGV to private companies. I am only out for 1 person as a taxi driver to the private vehicles and I am only able to get a good deal from them before I need to use them.
I am asking for your support to get the government to stop this happening. I have an old friend who uses HGV to travel to work, and cannot afford the cost of a taxi and I am the one who is stuck in a parking space. He needs to be able to use the vehicle and the company.

title: To stop the NHS from being privatised
body: We the undersigned demand that the NHS is privatised, it is a direct result of the decision of the European Union to leave the EU, and that the NHS be made to pay for 'privatisation' part way through.

title: Close the prison at Northern Ireland, to give time to the British people.
body: Close the prison at Northern Ireland, to give time to the British people.

body: The iPad is now the most widely used device in the home office, phones are now a necessity for the big businesses to employ and work in, but this has not changed. We hate to see a computer being used against us but we do not know how to use it.

title: Stop the University of Leeds charging students £65/year for teaching.
body:
Students at Leeds University are being charged £65.20 a year for teaching. This is not a breach of contract.
This is a breach of student conduct and should be dismissed.
Students are not taught how to do assignments, how to write homework, how to apply for courses or how to apply for grants. They are not taught how to get grants, how to apply for contracts or how to apply for grants. Students are taught the difference between a contract and an offer.
We ask that the government change this law so that students are taught the difference between a grant and an offer, how to apply for contracts and how to apply for grants.
The government must change this law to make it clear that students are taught the difference between a contract and an offer, how to apply for contracts and how to apply for grants.

body: There are many British Citizens in various European countries who are being repatriated despite UK Government and Parliament not being able to do so. They need our help and support to help them.

Having seen the recent killing of a woman by a 23 year old man I feel this needs to be passed on to the general public and to the people of the UK.

It is not the fault of the individual, but of the Government as it is not responsible for the consequences of the actions of predators.

As a UK citizen I feel the UK needs to protect the legal protections of legal predators.

body:
People having their properties rented out should be given a temporary ban on all properties in the UK.

We want the Government to allow the people who own properties in the UK to sell all properties to anyone with a valid tenancy agreement (such as a house) and rent them out in the event of a property being sold.

This would also help bring in more affordable housing for the under 25s, make it easier for people to rent out their property and give the same freedom for those in the community.

People wanting to purchase their property should be able to do so by signing a tenancy agreement and the right to sell it in the event of a property being sold.

title: No more refugees on UK shores
body: Thousands of refugees have crossed the Atlantic and into Europe and now we are seeing a huge influx of people from the Middle East. We should not accept these refugees on our shores. We should expel them, including the Muslim population. We must not accept them on our shores.

title: Fines for non-British Citizens
body:
The British Citizens of the UK are being unfairly penalized by the UK Government and the UK Parliament and Councils for the UK Government not to recognise their British citizenship.

Individuals who are NOT British Citizens should not be penalised for not being British.

title: Stop the use of the word "cyberbullying" in the press.
body:
The word cyberspace is used to describe an environment where the public is taught about cyberbullying. It is also used as a name for cyberbullying which is a criminal offence.

It is also used as a name for cyberbullying as it is not a crime.

A search on the internet for "cyberbullying" returns no evidence of it being a crime.

The word cyberspace should be used by legal authorities to refer to an environment where the public are taught about cyberbullying.

We the undersigned call on the government to allow the use of the word "cyberbullying" in the press.

Young people are exposed to many diseases and diseases that would cause them pain and suffering, the elderly and smokers are exposed to many diseases that could cause them harm.

Young people often choose to smoke, especially in the winter, as this is the best time to do so.

Young people should be allowed to smoke in the UK and the laws need to be changed so they can be protected against the health risks of smoking in the UK.

title: Stop the medical aid for cancer treatment
body: Currently the government is allowing terminally ill patients to have their treatment stopped in the name of preventing cancer. The government should fund this procedure whilst still allowing the cancer to continue to spread.

body: With the renewal of the TV licence, it is becoming more apparent that the BBC is not doing enough to ensure the BBC and its employees are not paid for anything they do not want. The BBC should be allowed to continue to pay its staff for the time it spends on promoting its programmes and in fact its profit making.

title: Criminalise smoking and consume of tobacco
body: Smoking encourages the consumption of tobacco, and is harmful to the health and well being of the population of the United Kingdom. Smoking is a risk to the health and well being of the population of the United Kingdom, and people should be aware of it and not consume it. Smoking is not a criminal offence.

title: Ban the use of milk products as a diabetogenic substance.
body:
Milk is a diabetogenic substance that is used to make anti-diabetic medications. Milk contains several chemical compounds which cause insulin resistance, and its use is linked to increased risk of diabetes in women.
I would like the government to ban the use of milk products as a diabetogenic substance, if it helps to prevent diabetes in women.

title: Stop the Israeli invasion of Gaza
body:
The Israeli government is doing everything possible to invade the Gaza Strip, and not only to stop the water shortage, but to destroy the infrastructure.

The Israeli state is using all available means to force the Gaza Strip to open up, and to destroy Gaza's infrastructure completely, including the water supply.

The British government is working closely with the Israeli government to secure the border between Gaza and Israel and to prevent further illegal crossings along the border as well as to ensure that there is no further illegal crossings crossing the border into Israel and the surrounding areas.

title: Constitutional right to vote.
body:
We the undersigned would like to have the right to vote in Parliament.

The right to vote for government is the government's right.

Note that the government does not have the right to vote for any particular political party, and so does not have the right to vote for any particular political party.

Therefore, the government as a whole has the right to vote for any particular party.

This is a constitutional right, for the whole of the country.

title: Stop child benefit payments to family members who die
body:
I am a mother with two children. One is 12 years old, the other is 14. They have never been apart for more than a year.

I believe that if the family member dies in any way, then the child benefits should be stopped.

I want to see the government make this a legal requirement.

title: Impose sanctions against Syria for war crimes
body:
We are calling for a credible plan that sanctions be enforced against Syria for war crimes.

We believe that the UK government and the international community cannot afford to let a war in Syria continue unless they are forced to pay a hefty price.

We believe that sanctions should be imposed on Syria to address the threat posed to Syria and its people.

We believe that the UK government and the international community can no longer afford to continue to allow this to continue.

We believe that we are not allowed to intervene in Syria, let alone carry out the action we want to see happen.

We believe that the UK government and the international community cannot afford to allow this to continue.

body:
People on public transport are being charged excessive parking charges. They are being charged excessive amounts on their way to work, and more often than not they are actually paying for the privilege of parking in a car.
To make parking more affordable for those on public transport, the Government should ensure that local authorities and transport companies have to pay for the cost of the car parking charge for those on public transport.

body: Smoking in public places is a criminal offence in the UK, currently the law does not allow people to smoke outside of the house and the law does not clarify what should be a 'smoking shop' or 'smoking club' for a person. The UK has made a big commitment to embrace and respect the smokers and the community, so why should we be forced to give them a criminal record when we can smoke!

title: Match the Football of Rugby to the English Football of the World
body: In the uk, England are playing the worst team in Europe, they have been beaten 3 times in a row, their opponents have been taken out of the competition and the England fans deserve a chance to be heard.

title: Review the consequences of a second referendum for the UK
body: In the event of any further referendum, the UK should not be allowed to remain in the EU or not have any laws passed which would put our country in the same situation as the rest of the world

title: Remove the ban on using the word 'drones' in a speech
body: In this day and age we are a part of the global community of drones, they can be used like any other weapon in pursuit of a target, this is an outdated term which has been used for decades. The word 'drones' is also used in reference to domestic drones, the term 'Drones' is a derogatory term with the use of the word 'drones' when referring to drones.

title: Make the most of a lifetime of work
body:
We are becoming very tired of being forced to take time off, or even having to do so to get a job, especially for those who aren't doing enough, and just to get a job.
The current system is too tight, and we need to get to the point where we can be self employed. We need to give ourselves another chance, and be able to get the job we want.

title: Allow the use of a mobile phone for public transport when travelling from London
body:
In London, the use of mobile phones for public transport is no longer allowed. This is despite the fact that some transport companies use a mobile phone during the day, to get to work.
It is also not allowed for people to use a mobile phone while in London.

title: Remove the national anthem from the football team
body: As a British citizen I have always felt that the national anthem should be removed from the game of football, and I feel that it was only fair to remove the national anthem from the game of football and replace it with a modern version.

title: Stop the glorification of suicide by calling it self harming!
body:
Every year, there is a suicide in our society. It's a lifetime of suffering, it's a life-long risk to yourself and to your loved ones.

We need to stop the glorification of suicide and stop the constant promotion of health risks such as heart attacks, cancer etc.

title: Stop The Corruption of State Pension
body: I am calling on the Government to do everything possible to prevent the corruption of state pensions.

title: make it a legal requirement for the government to broadcast/transmit dog reports/victims' statements/motions
body:
I have a 7 year old son who was attacked by a dog in an area where he was staying. He was 3 years old and had been given a bad story by the police about something he had to tell the police.
I want the government to make it a legal requirement for the government to broadcast/transmit dog reports/motions.

title: We, the people, demand the Government to pass a law requiring all UK vehicles to be fitted with a safety restraint system in all cars by the end of 2016
body:
There is a national demand for a law requiring all UK vehicles fitted with a safety restraint system in all cars by the end of 2016.

Sign the petition and let's get it passed.

title: Award all new schools with the highest grades for the 2017/18 school year
body:
The school is not in any way under any pressure to produce the best students in the school, it has been proven to be working well for years and currently BEST in the knowledge and teaching of the children.

We petition the government to award all new schools with the highest grades for the 2017/18 school year, they are the best in the knowledge of the children and the curriculum.

Examining the evidence, it appears the exam results are very encouraging and the students are showing the same results as the teachers, this is a very positive sign for the school.


Why was this petition rejected?



We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The criteria for awarding state-funded schools is the responsibility of the school.

You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/schools-to-make-their-best-children

title: Award the 'Dummy' of a British Soldier a Medal of Merit
body:
A British Soldier who served in the Middle East and North Africa for almost 20 years, was awarded the 'Dummy of a British Soldier' awarded to his fellow servicemen and women that served in the Middle East and North Africa for many years, including the British soldiers who were not awarded medals for bravery.

A Medal of Merit is undeserved, particularly in light of the recent tragic events in Syria and Iraq.

title: Petition for HMG to go back to the drawing board and give a straight forward review of the 2012 Formulae
body:
We petition the government to go back to the drawing board and give a straight forward review of the 2012 Formulae.

If you are a student, you are getting a lot of homework, and they are not working, and this is the case with most forms, the formulae are not working. We would like to see a fresh look at how the system works, and what it can do to get the best results.

title: Call for an immediate suspension of all UK foreign aid for six months
body:
The UK spends almost £250 billion per year on foreign aid, which is £350 billion more than the UK spends on developing and equipping the world. It is estimated that the UK spends £56 billion on foreign aid per year, which is £350 billion more than the UK spends on developing and equipping the world.

We are not in a position to say that we are not in a position to spend more money. The UK spends more than the world spends on foreign aid, and if we do not do so we risk committing monetary atrocities.

We would like to see the UK spend more money on foreign aid, not less, but more like the world spends on foreign aid.

title: University fees should be capped at £1070 per year
body: To allow students to study outdoors and see the world without a university, they should be paid a fee of £10,000 per year for the duration of the term, a fee of £50 per year for the duration of the term, a fee of £35 per year for the duration of the term, and a fee of £30 per year for the duration of the term.

title: Tougher sentencing for minor battery
body:
I'm calling for the government to make it mandatory for those who commit minor battery offences to be given a minimum 12-month jail term.

The current 5 year sentence for a lesser offence would make a person a lot less likely to commit minor battery offences.

Please sign this petition and help us to get tougher sentences for these serious crimes.

title: Ban the use of the word "Amnesty" in public
body:
Amnesty is a term used by politicians and celebrities to describe the conditions and conditions in which people are held in prison.

This petition aims to ban the use of the word "Amnesty".

The word "Amnesty" has long been used by politicians and celebrities to describe conditions and conditions in which people are held in prison.

This word is too long for political use and should be removed from public use.

I would like the word "Amnesty" banned in public in public in the name of "Amnesty", instead it's used with a more appropriate power, to describe conditions and conditions in which people are held in prison.

title: Postal processing
body:
Postal processing, is one of the most difficult things to do, and unfortunately, it is not always the best solution.

I propose that post offices have a system where post office employees can post their own computer but if they want to post their own computer, they have to pay the post office a fee to do so.

Since this fee is usually just a penny per post office employee, it is a small amount to pay for processing, and it is almost impossible to do.

Example: If I wanted to do post job within a day, I would have to pay a fee to a post office to obtain a computer.

That is a small amount of money to pay for processing, and it is near impossible to do.

title: No to cuts to the NHS
body: The cuts to the NHS are not just a grave concern to the NHS, they are unjustified.

title: Stop the Trump administration from turning a blind eye to immigrants
body: As the British people voted to leave the EU, we should not allow the government to be so taken advantage of by the foreign people.

title: Everest for people who have had a stroke
body: I believe that people who have had a stroke should not be allowed to have a new stroke. I would like the government to allow people to have a new stroke as they are the most vulnerable in society.

title: Lets make it illegal for the NHS to sell alcohol for profit
body:
Every year the NHS get a huge amount of funding from the NHS. The government should ensure that the NHS sell alcohol for profit for as much as possible.
The government should also make it illegal for the NHS to sell alcohol for profit for any other reason than having fun.



Why was this petition rejected?



We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Police Complaints Commission (IPSC) is responsible for investigating complaints against the Police. IPSC is independent of both the Government and Parliament.

You can find out how to contact IPSC here:

http://www.ipsc.org.uk/about-the-ipsc/contact-us

title: Take control of armed forces eg: use the N.I.S. to open up prisons to the public.
body: Currently there are too many armed forces in the uk and the N.I.S. is not making it a priority, it could be a decisive and long lasting change that would boost morale.

title: Referendum on whether there should be a Second EU Referendum
body:
The referendum result was a historic victory for the people of Britain. The people took the lead and voted to leave the EU.

https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/home-politics/brexit-brexit-eu-referendum-hard-vote-survey-poll-reveals.html

title: Government to put a stop to  illegal immigrants entering the UK
body:
Illegal immigrants are entering the UK illegally. They are making lives miserable for themselves and are being used as slave labour.

We want the government to put a stop to this illegal migration so we can keep our borders open.

title: Eniefield Bus Fare
body: To make the bus way more frequent on the main route of Eniefield, to make it harder for people to get to the town.

title: Make the National Self Employed Care Fund a public service
body:
In the UK, the National Self Employed Care Fund is funded by the government by way of a single fund called the Children’s Fund, which is funded by an annual tax from the government, as well as a tax on the purchase of goods and services in the UK, and by an annual tax on the sale of goods and services in the UK. This fund is a public service.

There are currently a large number of self employed carers, who are self employed and have worked for a long time, they need to be able to earn the right to work in the UK and their employment is essential to their employment.

Make the National Self Employed Care Fund a public service, not only for self employed people, but for all those who are self employed.

title: Extend the UK State Pension to cover the cost of travel expenses
body:
The government has to uphold the law to provide for all British citizens on benefits, including those on benefits, who require travel abroad.

This is a cost that is out of the control and cost the government nothing.

This petition calls for the government to extend the law to cover the cost of travel expenses to the UK by giving the costs of travel abroad to reimburse the taxpayer.

title: Pass a cap on the amount of times a child is allowed to sit on the toilet at school.
body:
This is the second time in a row that a child is allowed to sit on the toilet at school in their school year. The first time in Woolwich was in 2009 when a child was allowed to sit in a loo on the toilet.

We believe that children should be able to sit on the toilet without the possibility of being penalised.

title: Stop the NHS being forced to invest in private health companies
body:
The UK healthcare sector is facing a crisis of healthcare quality, quality of life, technology, patient care and patient care.

We call on the government to use all its powers to prevent the NHS from being forced to invest in private health companies.

title: Stop children being expelled from a school because they don't fit in
body: Children are expelled from school because they don't fit in, not because they don't have a good social group or a good family, and so they are only expelled because they don't fit in. They also don't have a good job and so they're forgotten about.

title: Vote on a 3rd EU referendum
body: We want to keep the EU and sign the policy of staying within the EU but we want the vote to be counted for the remain vote rather than the leave vote.

title: Stop the current Government using the £70 million a year Nhs budget to increase the national number of NHS staff, reduce their financial aid for the NHS and increase the funding for the NHS through the NHS Trust.
body:
The current Government is using the £70 million a year Nhs budget to increase the National number of NHS staff to 110,000, reduce funding for the NHS through the NHS Trust and increase the funding for the NHS through the NHS Trust



Why was this petition rejected?



Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The UK Government already has the power to set up a new NHS hospital, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

title: Save House of Lords, the House of Lords is the very heart of our democracy.
body:
The House of Lords is a place where people have the opportunity to be heard, not be seen to be representing their views, and where people witness the unforced inconvenience of being represented by an individual who is under house arrest.

Members of the House of Lords are not the sort of people who would be challenged or intimidated by the unfairness of the law, but the people who have the right to decide for themselves whether or not to be represented by someone.

We need to re-think the rules around how an individual can represent themselves.

title: Ban all plastic toys from schools from the beginning of school.
body: Our children are not equipped to give a proper thought to what they are using and what they need. This needs to be dealt with.

title: Change the law to require drivers to have a registration card with a photo ID
body: This law would do nothing to protect innocent drivers from mistake on the road. The law would not require drivers to have a card to be able to drive on the road. The requirement would not require a driver to have a photo ID as the law already allows that. The law would also require proof of identity first and only use if a driver is STUNNING or is suffering from a condition.

title: Tighten the rules on the use of durian refers to the use of a higher grade made by Grade 3 students in school and provide the same grades as grade 4 students
body:
If your child has a learning difficulties they should be allowed a grade for the year. The rules are for 3-7 years.

Please sign this petition to ensure that the rules are tightened and prevent the use of the term durian to refer to the use of a higher grade made by a grade 3 student.

title: Stop the ridiculous amount of tax increases for companies who already pay taxes in the UK.
body:
We all pay taxes, but we pay more than we can reasonably afford to pay, especially when we are earning £100,000 a year, in the UK.

We are constantly told we have enough to survive, and too little to pay.

We have little to no savings to put back into our pockets, and no means to access the money we are paying.

We pay a ridiculous amount of tax to the Government, and yet the Government keeps rolling taxes on us, dodging taxes on most income, and then not paying them.

We can no longer afford the taxes and have to pay for the tax bills that we are paying.

We need to stop the ridiculous amount of tax increases.

title: Give the NHS a Royal Assent from all the Governments
body:
The NHS has been placed in a low profile for too long. We are witnessing the same level of neglect and abuse as an NHS staff.

The NHS has been given special treatment for a long time. We have a duty of care to the people of this country, and this has to be recognised in all cases.

The NHS is a registered charity and should be recognised.

title: Make the BBC a true tool for the British People
body:
The BBC is the only organisation in the world that can make decisions about leaving the EU.

We believe the BBC is a real tool for the British people to make a decision about their future.

It's an invaluable tool for citizens of all countries,

It has a huge audience across the world,
It has a huge reach,

It is only fair that the BBC is allowed to continue to operate as it does and give the public the facts.

title: Allow all licensed drivers to drink at home
body: Many young drivers are being told to drink at home to avoid accidents. This is not something that should be allowed to happen. It is not something that is morally right or right by any means, and is worth considering.

title: Make it illegal to use the BBC license on any UK station
body: BBC are increasingly being moved from the BBC's licence to the BBC License. The BBC has a licence to broadcast all programmes on all UK stations. The BBC has no responsibility to the public.

title: Unfairly reward retailers for more than basic necessities.
body:
Considering the lack of affordable housing, food, clothes and other basic necessities, what is a retailer to do?
With a supermarket selling everything and just about everything, why should they reward them for a certain amount of hardworking hardworking people?
The government should not be paying for this to happen, and have it stopped.

title: Award the British Union of Labour for its service to the country and to the British people.
body:
The British people are fed up with petty politics, greed, and corrupt politicians.
The Government should be able to award the British Union of Labour for its service to the country and to the British people.

title: Make it a criminal offence to destroy evidence on a Crown Court case.
body:
It’s a criminal offence to destroy evidence on a Crown Court case.

The Crown Court has a unique right to prove its case before it’s heard, and this means that if a crime is proven beyond a reasonable doubt, there is no appeal to the courts.

I’m sure it’s unfair that the Crown have to prove its case before they have a chance to get a verdict.

I’m sure there’s a lot of other cases where this is considered even more damaging to a Crown case’s case than what is presented.

title: Request a second referendum on EU membership
body: The British people voted to leave the EU, but they are not allowed to vote because they are not allowed to speak on behalf of the UK. The British people are not allowed to vote because they are not allowed to speak for the people of the UK. The British people voted to leave the EU and now this is no longer the case. The people want certain things that are not discussed in the House of Commons.

title: Require all schools to ensure students can no longer have 'anti-social behaviour'
body:
Students are being punished for having an inappropriate relationship, especially with friends, family or children,

The damage caused to other people's lives is irreversible.

It can endanger our children's futures.

We believe there should be a law that states all schools must ensure all students have a safe environment and that this will only be for the benefit of their peers.

title: Remove fuel subsidies and tax concessions for the qualified fuel pensioners
body: Fuel subsidies and tax concessions for the qualified fuel pensioners are being allowed to be paid at the rate of inflation to pay for the current state of the country. The pensioners are being denied the same rights as other pensioners doing the same work. This is a form of exploitation.

title: Ban the new death penalty for criminals
body:
The new death penalty for crime is a barbaric and barbaric act which we in the UK should be appalled by.

The new death penalty is cruel and unbalanced.

It is a senseless act of violence which should be condemned.

title: Significant amounts of animal products in the supermarket & buy in bulk
body:
We need to have enough to live on. There are many animals and whole foods bought in the supermarket & in bulk which are used by many animals. We need to have some sort of animal testing.
We need to have enough as a nation to know what we are buying & not just a few small samples.
We need to be able to share what we are buying & not just our niche making decisions.

title: Suspend the U-turn on the EU referendum, for a second referendum and the result.
body:
The U-turn on Brexit is a victory for the people of Britain, and a victory for the country as a whole. It is a widespread embarrassment to the country that the UK won the referendum.

We have been betrayed by the United Kingdom, and the United Kingdom will not accept any more brexit. We are now in a position where we are no longer able to have a relationship with our own people.

We want the UK government to suspend the EU referendum until a new referendum is called.


Why was this petition rejected?



The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for suspending a referendum. Under no circumstances should the UK Government or Parliament suspend a vote on a vote on a referendum.

You can find out more here:

http://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/consultation/citizens-advice/referendum-statement-on-eu-referendum/

body: The UK government should suspend the 2018 football World Cup and immediately suspend the 2018 Paralympic Games, until a vote is taken on the future of the Paralympic Games.

title: Make the UK a better place to live in the 21st century
body: The UK was the last place for the UK to live in the 21st century. Now all we have is the UN. We are the UK's greatest export market.

title: Stop the new 3-4-5-6-7 rule
body: The government plan to introduce a new rule that if a person’s work is a major contributing factor to the economy they should have their pay reduced to the minimum wage. This is a fact that is a major factor in the rise of unemployment and the rise in student loan debt.

title: Make the BBC Radio National Service a compulsory school curriculum.
body:
The BBC Radio National Service is a compulsory school curriculum for all public sector professionals.

Teens will learn a lot about the world around them, in the form of radio, television and theatre.

The BBC Radio National Service is an excellent example of what it is capable of.

title: Make Parliament pay for the expenses of MPs who resign
body:
MPs who resigns from their parties have to pay their expenses.

This should be a free vote for the people of the UK. MPs should not have to pay for their expenses.

body: I am a member of the British Public, and believe in the right of the people to choose a Prime Minister, but I do not want to see a second term of PM, it's a job for the country, and not for the PM to be put in.

body: We are trying to get a UK Citizenship Service in the UK, but we are not getting one for the Syrian people because they are not refugees. They are just refugees, trying to get back their homes. We are trying to get a UK Citizenship Service in the UK but we are not getting one for them because they are not refugees. We are trying to get a UK Citizenship Service in the UK but we are not getting one for them because they are not refugees.

title: Remove UK citizens from the European Communities
body: As a UK citizen, the majority of our citizens are not allowed to live in the UK. The UK government has not been able to work with us because of the EU. Any UK citizen who is not a UK citizen should be subject to the same rules as other EU citizens working in the UK. After Brexit the EU were to allow us to continue to live in the UK and use the same rules as other EU citizens living in the UK. We are not a part of the European Communities and we have no right to live here in the UK.

body: This petition is to ask the Government to stop the deportation of the over 30s who have served their country for many years.

title: Ban the sale of fur to the UK and ban the sale of fur to non-UK nationals
body:
The UK government and politicians have no interest in banning the sale of any kind of fur for non-UK citizens.
Fur is an animal's fur, so why should it be forced onto non-human animals?
The Government and politicians are inciting conflict with the petition to ban the sale of fur.

title: To have a second referendum on whether the UK should remain in the EU.
body: With the EU referendum happening, we the undersigned want the debate on the subject to be raised in Parliament.

title: Respect the wishes of the people of this country
body: The Government should respect the wishes of the electorate of this country and prevent Brexit.

title: Legislate to make the right to live in UK a right
body:
The British people should be given the right to live in UK, both legally and mentally.

We live in a country that is not safe to live in in the UK, that is not fit for purpose.

The right to live in UK is one of the most important and well-known rights of the British people.

It is a right that should be extended to cover all aspects of the UK including housing, jobs, education, healthcare, public transport.

The British people should also be given the right to vote in the House of Lords.

I believe this would be a major step in the right direction to have a home-based, living, democratically-elected and democratically-elected government.

We also believe that the right to live in UK would be extended to include the right to vote for UK citizens who live abroad.

title: Make it illegal for an MP to spend time in a bank outside of the House of Commons.

title: Save the London Hospital/Mungo's Hospital NHS Trust
body:
The London Hospital NHS Trust (LHS) is a non profit operating hospital of 150,000 in the capital, setting up a highly respected and loyal team of nurses who are very well dependant on the investment of tax payers.

The London NHS Trust have been the envy of the country at a time when we need a new, modern medical style of care and we want to see the investment of NHS money redirected to the NHS Trust, when the London NHS Trust has to take a cut of the approximately £65 million a year in funding.

This is a loss for the NHS Trust and will be the final blow for a team that is going to be unable to compete for future employees.

title: Ban all non-children and adults from being in the main school.
body: The current law discriminates against children and adults who are under 18 years old. This is not a joke or a joke some adult parents are taking in a very serious and cruel way, and can cause serious injury and even death to children and adults. There should be no exceptions for any child under 18 and no children and adults at school.

title: Make it illegal to buy alcohol in supermarkets
body: Every year thousands of humans are killed for alcohol, in a single day. We need to make it illegal to buy alcohol in supermarkets, the government should pass this law to stop this happening.

title: Recall the decision to ban the use of the term 'Hipster' in the title of H.P.
body:
Frequently referred to as 'H.P' it is used to refer to a person who is heavily influenced by and influenced by a group of people. Whilst the term 'Hipster' is commonly used in the title of the title, I believe this is a misunderstood term which can easily be misunderstood.

H.P is widely used in the title of the title, but it is used as the title of a book, but for reference purposes only.

I believe that the term 'Hipster' should be banned.

title: MPs should be given a vote on a second referendum and be entitled to vote for a second vote.
body: We all have a right to vote, and as a nation we have a right to make our voices heard, but the other parties are more interested in winning the election than we are in losing it.

title: We the people demand that the House of Commons debates all MP’s pay the same as when they leave the House of Commons
body: MP’s in the House of Commons have been given a wage rise and they have not been given a wage rise for nearly 2 years. This is unacceptable.

title: Make it mandatory for all drivers to have good driving experience.
body: Have you ever hit a car on the road and it was not your fault? You have to have a good driving experience to drive safely.

title: The Government to repeal the death penalty by April 2014.
body:
The Government should repeal the death penalty by April 2014.
Lets start by making this change.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/2017/08/30/prison-death-penalty-fines-a-footprint/

title: Reject Romania's EU Referendum.
body: I want the UK to reject the EU referendum, as it is not democratic. I also want to get the EU to reconsider their decision, as it has already done so.

title: Scrap the evil hand-wringing of the EU referendum.
body:
We the undersigned call on the government to scrap the petitioners hand-wringing and to re-evaluate the Brexit vote.

This petition is extremely ill advised on some of the issues that affect us.

The people voted to leave the EU. They said they would bring about a better future for us. Now we have a general election. The government has decided they don't want to go further. They are making it harder for the British people to live and work in the UK.

We want the government to re-evaluate the decision and to re-evaluate the referendum result.

title: NHS to be held to account for the lack of safety and effectiveness of a product.
body: To make the NHS a more robust organisation and help to protect patients against the risks of unsafe drugs and treatments.

title: Significant improvements are needed to the NHS
body:
The NHS is in serious financial straits, with many people unable to work or pay for essential health care (eg: diabetes, cancer, heart disease, cancer treatments).

The Government needs to improve the services to the uninsured and the underinsured.

Disabled people are being denied vital health care services, as they are not insured.

We need to make a significant investment in the NHS.

title: Fireworks to be legalised
body:
Fireworks to be legalised.

The UK needs to have a law regulating the sale of fireworks.

The UK needs to have a law regulating the sale of fireworks to protect the public from being left in the dark for the duration of a fireworks display.

title: HMG should not be allowed to have any influence over the EU referendum result.
body:
In the wake of the outcome of the EU referendum, the government should not be able to speak for the people over the rule of law and the people over the will of the people.
Forcing the UK to leave the EU would be a complete and total failure of the UK government.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-eu-referendum-14902038

title: Suspend the launch of Virgin Media's Next Generation TV programme
body: Virgin Media have announced they will suspend the Next Generation TV programme "Next Generation TV" for good cause. They have also decided to stop "Extreme" content.

title: Allow the purchase, sale, and use of aircraft and vehicles in England, Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland
body:
It is recognised by the United Kingdom Government, the Government of Ireland and the Government of Scotland, that all aircraft and vehicles flying into England, Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland are restricted to a cost to the taxpayer of £1,000 per person per annum and that all aircraft and vehicles flying into England, Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland are sold until they are sold to the public, at the date of sale.

This will allow the aeromodist to fly into the UK without any fear of reprisal by the Government of Ireland or the Government of Scotland.

title: Make it a criminal offence to force a voter to vote for a specific party
body:
Voting is a democratic process.

The result of a vote should be the result of a vote in which the majority of the electorate voted for a specific party.

If the result was very close, a vote should be called to make it a criminal offence to force a voter to vote for a specific party.

title: Trial of a new law to force the police to stop searching for drugs on the street
body:
I am a member of the Green Party who believe that the UK needs to look into the justice system. We believe that in the Black Boxes we find drugs and criminals but we cannot honestly search for these drugs on the street.
In the same way the Police are in the Black Boxes when searching for drugs. I believe that the UK needs to change the law so that the police do not search searches for drugs on the street.


Why was this petition rejected?



This would be a decision for someone who is not a police officer, but would like to become a police officer.

title: Make it compulsory for children to take a GCSE for the first time
body: Children should be taught to do GCSEs for the first time, because GCSEs are the future of the world and it is a future that is being lost. It is a true achievement for children and should be recognised.

title: Ban the use of the word 'Lethal Weapon: 9/11' during the 12 Hours of Terror
body:
In the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks, the Government has started a campaign to ban the use of the word 'Lethal Weapon' at all times during the day. This is the same word used by the French in reference to the 9/11 attacks.

The use of the word 'Lethal Weapon' during the 12 Hours of Terror is a common occurrence. It is used by many people all over the world to refer to the 9/11 attacks, and is used by many people as a way of promoting hatred and to promote the use of deadly force to stop the attack.

We ask that the Government uses the word 'Lethal Weapon' in their daily news and in public, and that the Government, in their daily newspaper, use the word 'Lethal Weapon' in their daily news and in public.

title: Reinstate the death penalty in the UK
body: The death penalty has gone up in the last couple of months, leading to a rise in murder, rape and murder. There are people like JonBenét or Aaron which have been tried for murder and have been found guilty of this crime.

title: Abolish the individual benefits system.
body:
Being a single parent, I have had to struggle to get the right to live independently. With the new benefit system, I feel that the individual benefit system is not working for others. They have been for their entire lives, and are still doing so.
I think the benefits system needs to be drastically overhauled. The benefits system, by and large, is not working for everyone. It is not working for everyone.

I believe that the benefit system needs to be drastically overhauled. The benefits system, by and large, is not working for everyone. It is not working for all. It is not working for everybody.

You are here:

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-3667055

You could start a petition calling on the Government to change the rules on benefit application fees and to make it mandatory that a person must pay an annual fee of at least £25,000.

title: Stop the cuts to the NHS and give NHS emergency staff full pay.
body: The NHS is run by a group of people with no real medical training. They are trained for the job and not for the service. This is not fair.

title: Make the 2016 EU referendum a legal requirement for all UK citizens to vote.
body:
As a result of the EU referendum, British citizens who wish to vote remain in the EU are legally obliged to vote.

This would be done by introducing a legal requirement for all UK citizens to vote and to send a survey to all UK citizens who wish to vote.

title: Stop the coastguard culling the foxes
body: The foxes are a nuisance and cause many health problems. These foxes are everywhere and are a nuisance to the visitor. The culling would stop the foxes from getting rid of themselves, and it would make a nice deterrent.

People who are working full time are paid less than single people working full time.

People working part time are paid over £2,000 less than single people working full time.

People who are single are paid over £2,000 less than single people working full time.

People who are single are paid up to £2,000 less than single people working full time.

Workers who work full time are paid over £2,000 less than single workers working full time.

Workers who work part time are paid over £2,000 less than single workers working full time.

Workers who are single are paid over £2,000 less than single workers working full time.

title: Fund the NHS for the next generation with funding of £200m per year
body: The NHS is the most expensive in the world, and its future is at stake. The funds for the NHS will be put into the NHS as part of a £1bn-£2bn (£5bn-£10bn) budget during the next parliament.

title: Stop the funding of Conservative Party political advertising
body: I think that the Conservative Party has a lot of un-doing going for them. They have the worst record of current MPs voting for Conservative Party political advertising. It is illegal to use Conservative Party political advertising in this way.

title: Treat all Labels and ID Cards for Work and Reservations as Work Permit
body:
The government should clarify the terms of working and reserving a working holiday after the event is complete. This can include holiday to visit family, work and visit friends and family during the day, or holiday to enjoy nature and enjoy the view of the countryside and the Chateau de la Garde.

The government should make it mandatory for all UK citizens working after the event to have a working holiday entitlement.

title: Replace the Law on the Debts of Millionaire and Corporate Directors
body:
The aim of this petition is to make law that all corporate directors and their immediate families are entitled to a refund of their debt owed to the government.
The current law is

title: Stop the NHS from forcing people to use IVF medications for menopause
body:
I believe the NHS should be forced to sign this petition, because it is becoming too common for menopause to take place after menopause.

1) Menopause is a medical condition, it is not something that you can pass down to your children.
2) Women get a long course of IVF medication after menopause, but the menopause is not reversible.

3) The NHS is being forced to use a very narrow range of IVF medications.

4) Women suffering from menopause will be forced to suffer longer and longer with long term side effects.

title: Oppose the practice of stripping or distancing people's names and their families.
body:
To make a general public aware of the practice of stripping or distancing people's names and families, the government should make this a criminal offence.



Why was this petition rejected?



We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

title: Stop the use of cameras in India
body: I am asking the government to stop the use of cameras in India. We are seeing people being hurt and attacked by police officers and if they are using a gun there is no need for a police force.

title: Sack Nigel Farage from the party
body:
Nigel Farage is clearly not fit for the job and needs a good replacement. He has not shown enough respect for the system he is running in. He has no confidence in the party he is running for.
He is totally unsuitable for the job.


Why was this petition rejected?



This petition is similar to yours:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/116397

title: Close Facebook and Twitter
body: I want to see Facebook and Twitter shut down due to a petition to close all the sites related to the use of facebook and twitter

title: Bring back national service
body: We want the government to bring back national service for ALL the men and women of the armed forces. Service is a good thing and our military are a good service.

title: Make it the law for all people to have a pet
body: Pet owners should be required to pay the tax on their pet as if it were a human. These should be reduced to the level of a human being.

title: Enact legislation in the event of a vote by the electorate in favour of a referendum
body:
Currently there is no law in place to prevent the vote of a majority of the electorate on any way to leave the EU.

A referendum should only be legal if all options are considered.

The referendum should be held in the year after the result is final.

title: Make car insurance free for every self employed person
body:
Myself and many self employed people are paying a tax on why we are self employed.

We live in a country that is totally different from the rest of the world, we all have the same rights and responsibilities.

We are paying tax on it as we have no choice.

People who are self employed should be allowed to pay tax on their profits.

This will not only help motoring but will also have a positive impact for the UK economy and the people of the UK.

Make it a priority to make car insurance free for every single self employed person, free for everyone.

title: Save the U.K. from Brexit
body: We the undersigned would like to see the government and parliament prevent the UK leaving the EU, to stop the demise of our country and the destruction of our future.

title: Make it a criminal offence to drive in the UK
body: We want the government to make it a criminal offence to drive in the UK. If you are driving in the UK you should be stopped for a period of at least 2 hours. If you are driving for any other reason you should be stopped and it should be a fine.

title: Make it compulsory for people with only one child to have a second child.
body: People with only one child are being overlooked. If you have a child who is up to date with the rest of the family, you should have the option to have a second child. There is a particularly long list of children with a family history that are not available for the general population to see but are made available if the child goes into a relationship with someone other than their family.

title: Make David Cameron a patron of the South Yorkshire Army!
body:
David Cameron is a patron of the South Yorkshire Army!
He was a hero the moment he was shot, he is a hero in the right for the right reasons and has always been a good friend of the people of South Yorkshire. He is a great guy and he has to be praised for that.
He is a very loyal friend and he is a friend of everyone who listens to him. He is a great friend of the people of South Yorkshire and I think he should be given a knighthood.

title: Increase the minimum wage for young people aged 16 to 24
body:
The government has been completely unresponsive to the growing number of young people aged 16 - 24 in particular and the fact that teenagers are making more money doing the same things more than older people.

Young people aged 16 - 25 must pay a minimum wage of £8.90 per hour, £9.90 per hour, £10.90 per hour and £11.90 per hour.

For young people aged 16 - 25 (and anyone over the age of 16 12 - 18) the minimum wage would be £10.90 per hour, £11.90 per hour and £12.90 per hour.

Those aged 16 - 20 earning £20.00 per hour would pay £6.00 per hour, £9.00 per hour, £10.00 per hour and £11.00 per hour.

title: Dismiss all the public petitions that are signed by more than 65 million people.
body:
The number of people who sign an online petition is increasing, but the number of people who sign an online petition is decreasing, with everyone signing a petition for the same reason.

We want to have a law that we all sign the same petition.

This will not stop people signing their own.

We need to have a law that all signatures are given to the same person and all signatures are given to the same organisation for the same reason.

title: Allow the sale of fireworks to all ages.
body: I think it is a great idea to open a school and have fireworks show all over every school. It also helps to keep children safe.

title: London to become a Bank of England
body:
London to become a Bank of England.
London to become a Bank of England.
London to become a Bank of England.
London to become a Bank of England.
London to become a Bank of England.
London to become a Bank of England.

We can only accept petitions which call for actions that are the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament.

The Bank of England is the responsibility of the Bank of England, not the Government or Parliament.

http://www.bankofengland.co.uk/

title: STOP the extreme torture and murder of our children and grandchildren.
body:
The government needs to do something about this. It's unconstitutional and needs to be stopped immediately.
Children are being tortured to death by the government for no reason other than to save them from being tortured.

Please sign and share, it needs to be stopped so we can show them the real truth.

title: Allow children to join the Army when they are 17 years of age.
body:
Children make up a small proportion of the Armed Forces and many are coerced into serving on the frontline. They are sometimes sent to war zones where they are forced to fight. Many are forced to join up and fight for the same cause as the soldiers who serve them.

There are many examples of children being forced to join the Armed Forces when they are 18 years of age and served. Many have given up fighting for the same cause and are now seeing their family members being forced to join the Army.

title: Remove the age of consent for any procedure in the United Kingdom
body: It is mandatory for women to be given access to intimate healthcare regardless of their age. I believe that as young people we should have access to one.

title: Make it illegal for a person to carry a weapon while working and using a mobile phone
body: It’s only fair that a person with a valid license should be able to carry a weapon while working and using a mobile phone.

title: Government to make a new referendum on Brexit
body: The UK voted to leave the EU, we have no right to keep paying EU taxes and the UK Government should make a new referendum on Brexit

title: Build a National Sign Language Project in the UK for the Civil Aviation Industry
body:
The Civil Aviation Industry needs a National Sign Language Project. The fine print will be a very large part of the process, however, it will be a very important part of the process.

There are many individuals who have no idea what they are talking about. They are not trained to do this and are not trained to speak a language other than English.

The Speaker of the House of Commons has to prepare a 'Business Speaker' for the House of Commons to have the ability to speak English. We want the Speaker of the House of Commons to have a voice that is not just an expression of the will of the people but the will of the nation.

title: Overturn the school buses currently operating on their new route.
body: The University of Manchester is planning on upgrading to a bus route that runs on a route that is not used by the local community. This is a new route that will be mainly used by the children of the area, rather than all of the local public and schools.

title: Stop the BBC from broadcasting live TV advertising
body:
The BBC has deliberately lied about their live TV advertising. We the undersigned are very concerned about the manner in which the BBC is advertising live TV and the urgent need to move swiftly to stop this.
There is a petition calling for the BBC to be allowed to broadcast live TV advertising in the future if that is something they are concerned about. We are calling for the BBC to do this and not be allowed to do it as it is not impartial.

title: Honduran citizenship
body: I would like the Government to provide free British passports for the new generation of the Hassanian people who have no family in the UK.

title: Reverse the decision to offer more tax relief to the poorest households in the UK
body: The poorest families in the United Kingdom eat less and still have to subsidise incredibly high prices. Not only are the poorest families in the UK highly indebted to the government, they are incredibly irresponsible in their own financial affairs and are constantly growing in debt.

title: Stop the closure of the BBC.
body:
The BBC is the second largest broadcaster in the UK, with revenues totalling £12.4bn in the 2011-14 financial year.

The BBC is a public service broadcaster that is funded by the public purse, and is owned by a small group of people, not by the BBC.

They are a large public service broadcaster, and deserve to be treated the same as the BBC.

title: Bring Back The Death Penalty
body:
I am a 17 year old who has been involved in an active drug addiction for a short time and gotten a pretty good sentence.

I feel that this is a very wrong and cruel punishment, and I believe that this should be brought back.

title: Rethink government plans to bring back the death penalty in the UK
body: The government should rethink its plans to reintroduce the death penalty to the UK. This is a disgraceful proposal that should be scrapped completely.

title: Freeze the UK's debt because of Brexit.
body: The government debt has now reached an all time high. The UK is in the same position as the rest of the EU due to Brexit. At the moment, the UK has only £40bn of debt. This is the equivalent of more than £100 million of tax payers income.
